reviews.review_msg: He is unbelievably unprofessional and does not provide clear guidance to his work. He does not teach the course and uses an answer guide to mark essay questions. It does not matter if your answers are correct or not, if he does not see your answers on his answer guide he will mark you incorrect.

Dr. Sinclair is a great instructor. The course itself was really hard combined with his hard marking, but you learn all of the topics in depth. His feedback is really helpful and helps you understand the content. He is also approachable by email and is willing to clarify any issues. After hard studying and memorizing, the exams are fair.

Horrible! I didn't do so well on the midterm so I went to see him to see what I can do to improve. And he basically just shrugged his shoulders and said that people who get lower marks contribute to the distribution. I finished the course but I had a sour taste for genetics. 2 years later I went on to get an A in Genetic Analysis with a better prof

There's no doubt his lectures are boring, but he's a really nice prof! I was just under the cut-off for the next grade and he bumped me up because i did significantly better on the final exam than the midterms! I don't know any other prof that would have done that. He seems to really care about his students and wants them to do well.

A GREAT prof! Tells you exactly what he expects you to know on the exams. Notes are fairly concise and to the point. Some lectures can be fairly dry, but ultimately if the material at times is dry, then that's to be expected. He's overall quite generous with marks,and his exam are very fair.

He is generous with marking and his test is very straight forward from the lecture slides  (but the exams are not easy). In Genetics, spend more time on problem solving and go to your tutorial. Dr.Sinclaire doesn't try to trick you in the exams. Everything is in the notes and he tells you what things you should study. This is why I like him.
Course is so easy, just listen to recorded lectures online (because its nearly impossible to stay awake during class) and your good to go.

He's such a cute old man!  His midterms weren't too bad, but he's really picky with stuff. Study the practice midterms he gives out because a lot of his exam questions are based on those.  Overall all this course was okay.
easy course, very easy marking....

I recommend him because you can just study his letured and do well. You really donot need to study the complicated stuff in book. Also his midterms and especially final was pretty easy. I  did not study as much I should have been but still I got a B
good prof. warning: very boring! but he knows his stuff and knows how to teach. study his notes and you'll do perfectly fine on midterm and finals!
Organized online lecture notes, obviously knowledgeable about the material but his lectures doesn't add a lot to the notes.  Course is very straight forward, grading is fair, exams were easy enough.

yep, very boring prof, no matter how hard i try, i still manage to zone out for the majority of the class. but straight forward, midterms are fair, just know the stuff he goes over in lecture and you'll do fine

I just gotta give full credit for this prof. His notes are tidy(sort of), he is a friendly person, and most importantly, he gives out straight-forward exams! I got myself an A there. Just study for his notes, and that will gurantee you a pass!
Easy prof + Clear + online notes + online lecture tape. Eventhough i fell asleep in class all the time (due to his monotone), the lecture can be accessed at anytime.
Nice guy.  Very available and willing to give help.  Fair exams, no tricks; questions either from lecture notes or recommended problems in text.  Text book is a must and do all recommended problems.

Lecture notes are great study tools, but if you go to lecture to listen to him read them to you in a monotone voice get ready to sleep. His exams are fair though and very approachable for help. Always tells you what you need to know and what you don't for exams which is always a plus.
His midterms were fair....but final is hard and long!!
She's an absolute gem. One of the best profs I have had at SFU. Her lectures are so clear and her exams were really fair. I would recommend waiting for her to teach this course if you can.

Esther is better than i could have ever hoped! Her exams are fair, The midterm had averages in the low 80's to high 70's. We had a prof come and teach while she was away and both of his lectures did not make any sense at all, when she came back she re did both in 30 mins and they were perfectly clear! Take Bisc 202 with her if you have the option!

Wouldn't want to take Genetics with any other prof! She's the best cause she doesn't focus on cramming as much info into the course, she'll continue to go over topics if the class didn't understand it. Midterms were fair just got to study and make sure you have a good understanding of the material can't just memorize it

Great personality and always willing to help. Sometimes mutters to herself but jokingly. Second midterm is harder so make sure to study for it. Don't get lazy at the end of the course even though it gets a bit more confusing.

professor verheyen is very good at conveying the important points of each chapter so attend her class. MT 1 was long but fair, MT 2 was easy (could be b/c of TA strike bc we used bubble sheet) but the Final was brutal. DO the assignments and text book question (they are relevant for MT).

Esther is wonderful at teaching genetics. She is also funny and makes lectures fun to attend. The first midterm was fair, the second was easy, but the final was way too hard. Do the practice questions that she assigns! I guarantee you they will show up on the final exam.

Definitely my favourite prof. Great lecturer, very fair, good sense of humour, and more than willing to do what it takes to make sure everyone gets it. The only thing is midterm 1 was too long. Just ATTEND lectures (and listen), do the practice problems and you'll do fine!

All lectures are very organized, the midterms are hard but fair. She is always punctual to class and demonstrates a sincere interest in what she teaches. Side note: pretty attractive for a mom of 2 kids. you rock!
Not enough time for midterm #1. My last page was blank and the one before that was blindly writing in the last seconds of the test. Most questions seemed fair though.
questions on the first midterm were very fair. HOWEVER, I personally did not have nearly enough time to finish, nevermind look over questions.

She is quite nice and helpful. It was a big class and the avgs were the highest i've heard so far, like ~70% for mts. Final suddenly got a lot harder and conceptual. She focused a lot more on the last part of the material. Avg dropped a lot there. Note that she may give you hints in lec, but she may not put that on the exams. Do the practice Q!

She sometimes has a bit of a attitude towards her students and doesn't seem to respect alternative study methods in my opinion. She, however, tries to be helpful and her teaching methods/notes are good. Lots of practice questions and opportunities to learn the material. Tutorial is absolutely useless unless you are really struggling with the course

She is a great prof. She's really good at explaining concepts and she is a very helpful in office hours. Her exams are really long but the they are fair in terms of the material that you are tested on. I would definitely recommend taking the class with her.

Midterm one was too long, midterm two was too short, the final was LONG and tricky with a lot of unexpected questions. I thought she would question us on more important material rather than the difference between mitosis and meiosis....but whatever. She is very intelligent and knows her stuff, I wish I had her brain

Very knowledgeable prof, one of the better ones at SFU I found. For exams, midterm 1 was long, and midterm 2 was a little easier. Be sure to know your stuff! Final is a little tricky but overall it was all right. Be sure to do the textbook questions at the back of the chapters!!! They are VERY helpful!!

She's cool. Midterm 1 was way too long, couldn't finish in time. Midterm 2 was better. The assignments were representative of the type of questions we'd expect on the exams. Final was long, i had the biggest headache writing it. But it was ok, not bad. Just too long, almost fell asleep! There were some tricky questions though

She is a really good prof. Midterms were fair, but long. So write quickly and don't waste time. Assigned questions from the textbook are very similar to exam questions, so make sure you do them!! Tutorials really helped as well, TA was good with showing us problems we could expect on exams.
Great prof.  Long exams so make sure you know ur stuff and can write fast.  All information comes from ppt so don't buy thy text.
she is awesome
She's was very helpful and is always willing to help students if you have a reasonable question. Good prof overall. Follow her slides and do the recommended exercises and you'll do well.

She's a very good lecturer but isn't very helpful. E-mails seemed like there was no effort put into it. She also seems very stern and unapproachable and would sometimes get angry at the class. Exams were all over the place. First one was WAY too long, 2nd one was WAY too easy, and the final was pretty hard too. Overall OK prof.

She's a very typical prof. She likes to keep things tidy and keep class in order. Lectures with great clarity and give out very helpful/comprehensive notes. For her exams you have to do every single practice questions assigned, do not skip a single one, or else it will not be enough. Her exam is overall easier than those questions though.
Nice
class was ok
Her notes are short and informative. I really enjoyed her course. If you do the practise questions at the end of the text  you'll be just fine.
quality of lectures and her notes were pretty sucky. alot of roundabout explanations in class and disorganization in her notes. had to figure out most of it outside of class/with TA's.

She is a good prof although there are many times when she would contradict herself.. requires a lot of self-study which i did to get an A in the end.. lectures weren't that effective in helping me to understand..

She is an awesome prof, but wasn't totally clear on her marking scheme and got mad at students for asking about it. Highly recommended prof however, read the notes and be able to write fast on the exams

Dr. Verheyen is the best prof i've had at SFU, able to communicate very well in class, she knows her stuff.  Tests were tougher than normal, but if you put the work in you'll be fine.  And she is a FOX, i never missed a class!!!
Good teacher, tough exams.  Notes good/clear and she has great understanding of genetics, but expects too much on exams.  Exams (including final) go beyond notes and text book.

amazing prof, very clear and knows her stuff VERY THOROUGHLY!!! but final was tough! there's like 16 pages and at least half of it is about drosophila... fruit flies and more fruit flies!! but overall the course is awesome, and the prof even more so!
Dr. Verheyen is an amazing professor!  One of the best at SFU.
An excellent prof.  An excellent course.  Hard exams, but if you know your pwr point notes, and can write fast, you will be fine.
she has a high interest in genetics. She's funny but very often confused in her notes as well.
Wonderful teacher!

her class is not so bad. sometimes, she trapped herself in the genetic puzzle. you may not feel sleepy in her class because she is hot!!!lol. overall is not so bad. two versions of exams, one is hard, and the other is easy. thus, it tests your luck during the exam.
AMAZING PROFESSOR!
This professor is good! Clear, good at explaning and a nice person.

She actually cares about students understanding the material. She will pause every so often to ask whether there are questions or anything to be clarified. Her problem sets are hilariously simple compared to the ones administered by other profs.
Great prof!  She teaches the materials very clear!  Question on the finals or midterms are reasonable and not tricky!
This course is okay, its not to hard

Very interested in what she is teaching. Always very helpful and open to questions.  Midterms were okay, somewhat lengthy but questions weren't a killer. Lectures are dynamic and she makes cute jokes.
No Comments
